repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.unittitle: Pre-Civil War and Civil War Southern Railroad Tickets and Receipts

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized in one series.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: These proclamations were found in the Ryder Collection of Confederate Archives in 2011; the Ryder collection was cataloged as part of the WPA in 1939/1940 but in later decades the catalog ( A Calendar of the Ryder Collection of the Confederate Archives at Tufts College 1940) was forgotten and library staff added other materials to the Ryder collection, usually items from the South, from the 18th and 19th century and around the time of the Civil War.
Because the proclamations were not part of the original Ryder collection, items were removed and a separate, 'artificial' collection was created.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains railroad tickets for slaves, the general public, and soldiers of the Confederate States of America. The bulk of the material in this collection is dated from 1859 to 1860. The railroad tickets are from Richmond, Virginia to a several cities, such as Montgomery, Virginia, Vicksburg, Virginia, and Selma, Alabama.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. No documentation is available regarding the intellectual property rights in this collection.

did.unittitle: Pre-Civil War and Civil War Southern railroad tickets and receipts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains railroad tickets for slaves so-called 'negroe tickets' from 1859, undated pre-Civil War tickets, confederate soldier tickets, and Southern Express received from Treasurer Elmore.

did.unittitle: Traintickets for slaves: 'Negro Tickets,' Richmond and Memphis as well as Memphis and Charleston Railroad
General traintickets for various railroad lines

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Train tickets for Richmond & White Sulphur Spr'gs line; Richmond & Danville & South-Side R. R. to Lynchburg line; and Richmond & Danville Railroad Company for Richmond to Big Tunnel/Montgomery Springs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Furlough tickets for Richmond and Danvellie Railroad Company from Richmond to various cities; tickets for various railroad companies from Richmond to Montgomery as well as from Richmond to Vicksburg, Richmond to Selma, and Richmond to Grand Junction.
